comments:
Eclipse fails to start when only seamonkey on the system with the following:

*** Bug 134421 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 134041 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
FYI, I had the same problem using Ubuntu Dapper and M6. Installing the mozilla-browser package from Dapper's Universe repository fixed the problem for me.
fixed > 0411 by using nsIWebBrowserStream whenever it's available
*** Bug 134421 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #3)
> FYI, I had the same problem using Ubuntu Dapper and M6. Installing the
> mozilla-browser package from Dapper's Universe repository fixed the problem for
> me.

Thanks for the tip! This also works for me.

Hm. Does this actually make Firefox work as Browser for SWT on Linux? This error here looks quite similiar to the one you get when using Firefox.

Ben
Though I have not seen it, it is quite possible that the latest firefox would have had this same error (now fixed) since it has the same base as mozilla/seamonkey/etc.

Firefox from mozilla.org is statically compiled and does not
support embedding, so it should never work with firefox
unless you're using firefox from a linux distribution that
is dynamically compiled.
Right, I meant dynamically-compiled Firefox's whose Geckos are new enough to have moved stream loading from nsIDocShell to nsIWebBrowserStream.
*** Bug 103620 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
